Package neqsim.fluidmechanics.flownode

Class FlowPatternDetector

java.lang.Object
neqsim.fluidmechanics.flownode.FlowPatternDetector
public class FlowPatternDetector extends Object
Utility class for detecting flow patterns in two-phase pipe flow.

Implements various flow pattern prediction models including Taitel-Dukler (1976), Baker chart, and Barnea (1987).

Reference: Taitel, Y., & Dukler, A.E. (1976). "A model for predicting flow regime transitions in horizontal and near horizontal gas-liquid flow." AIChE Journal, 22(1), 47-55.

Version:
1.0
Author:
ASMF

  • Method Details

    • detectFlowPattern

      public static FlowPattern detectFlowPattern(FlowPatternModel model, double usg, double usl, double rhoG, double rhoL, double muG, double muL, double sigma, double diameter, double inclination)
      Detects the flow pattern using the specified model.
      Parameters:
      model - the flow pattern prediction model to use
      usg - superficial gas velocity (m/s)
      usl - superficial liquid velocity (m/s)
      rhoG - gas density (kg/m³)
      rhoL - liquid density (kg/m³)
      muG - gas viscosity (Pa·s)
      muL - liquid viscosity (Pa·s)
      sigma - surface tension (N/m)
      diameter - pipe diameter (m)
      inclination - pipe inclination from horizontal (radians, positive = upward)
      Returns:
      the predicted flow pattern

    • detectTaitelDukler

      private static FlowPattern detectTaitelDukler(double usg, double usl, double rhoG, double rhoL, double muG, double muL, double sigma, double diameter, double inclination)
      Detects flow pattern using the Taitel-Dukler (1976) mechanistic model.

      This model is applicable to horizontal and near-horizontal pipes. It uses physical transition criteria:

      • Stratified → Slug: Kelvin-Helmholtz instability
      • Slug → Annular: Liquid film stability
      • Stratified → Annular: Minimum gas velocity for film suspension
      • Bubble → Slug: Maximum void fraction (~0.25)
      Parameters:
      usg - superficial gas velocity
      usl - superficial liquid velocity
      rhoG - gas density
      rhoL - liquid density
      muG - gas viscosity
      muL - liquid viscosity
      sigma - surface tension
      diameter - pipe diameter
      inclination - pipe inclination
      Returns:
      the detected flow pattern

    • detectBakerChart

      private static FlowPattern detectBakerChart(double usg, double usl, double rhoG, double rhoL, double muL, double sigma)
      Detects flow pattern using the Baker (1954) empirical chart.

      Uses dimensionless groups based on superficial mass fluxes.

      Parameters:
      usg - superficial gas velocity [m/s]
      usl - superficial liquid velocity [m/s]
      rhoG - gas density [kg/m³]
      rhoL - liquid density [kg/m³]
      muL - liquid dynamic viscosity [Pa·s]
      sigma - surface tension [N/m]
      Returns:
      detected flow pattern

    • detectBarnea

      private static FlowPattern detectBarnea(double usg, double usl, double rhoG, double rhoL, double muG, double muL, double sigma, double diameter, double inclination)
      Detects flow pattern using the Barnea (1987) unified model.

      Extension of Taitel-Dukler for all pipe inclinations.

      Parameters:
      usg - superficial gas velocity [m/s]
      usl - superficial liquid velocity [m/s]
      rhoG - gas density [kg/m³]
      rhoL - liquid density [kg/m³]
      muG - gas viscosity [Pa·s]
      muL - liquid viscosity [Pa·s]
      sigma - surface tension [N/m]
      diameter - pipe diameter [m]
      inclination - pipe inclination angle [rad]
      Returns:
      the detected flow pattern

    • detectBeggsBrill

      private static FlowPattern detectBeggsBrill(double usg, double usl, double rhoG, double rhoL, double diameter, double inclination)
      Detects flow pattern using the Beggs-Brill (1973) correlation.

      Empirical correlation for all pipe inclinations.

      Parameters:
      usg - superficial gas velocity [m/s]
      usl - superficial liquid velocity [m/s]
      rhoG - gas density [kg/m³]
      rhoL - liquid density [kg/m³]
      diameter - pipe diameter [m]
      inclination - pipe inclination angle [rad]
      Returns:
      the detected flow pattern

    • calculateLiquidHoldup

      public static double calculateLiquidHoldup(FlowPattern pattern, double lambdaL, double nFr, double inclination)
      Calculates the liquid holdup using the Beggs-Brill correlation.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the flow pattern
      lambdaL - no-slip liquid holdup (input liquid fraction)
      nFr - Froude number
      inclination - pipe inclination (radians)
      Returns:
      the actual liquid holdup
